metadata.title: CVE-2016-9643 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The regex code in Webkit 2.4.11 allows remote attackers to cause a denialof service (memory consumption) as demonstrated in a large number of ($(open parenthesis and dollar) followed by {-2,16} and a large number of +)(plus close parenthesis).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9643` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.16.1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.16.1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.16.1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.16.1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.16.1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.16.1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkitgtk: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
webkit2gtk package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.16.1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
